original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The sound of rejoicing in Jerusalem could be_

_heard far away._ (Neh. 12:43)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The praises that were heard were the result of God's

help overcoming the opposition of enemies like

Sanballat and the rebuilding of the wall. What has

God given us that should cause our praises to overflow into praise?

IS IT GOD'S DIRECTION IN OUR LIFE? IS IT THE COMFORT

HE ALONE CAN PROVIDE IN THE TIME OF TROUBLE? OR

IS IT OUR ULTIMATE GIFT OF SALVATION?

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: The praises that were heard were the result of God's help overcoming the opposition of enemies like Sanballat and the rebuilding of the wall. What has God given us that should cause our praises to overflow into praise? IS IT GOD'S DIRECTION IN OUR LIFE? IS IT THE COMFORT HE ALONE CAN PROVIDE IN THE TIME OF TROUBLE? OR IS IT OUR ULTIMATE GIFT OF SALVATION?
original_verse_text: The sound of rejoicing in Jerusalem could be heard far away.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, overflowing with praise for the wondrous works You have done in our lives. Whether it is the guidance You have provided, the comfort You have offered in times of trouble, or the gift of salvation that You have so graciously bestowed upon us, we give You all the glory and honor. Your steadfast love endures forever, and Your faithfulness to all generations is a testament to Your unwavering presence. May our praises resound with the same fervor as the people of Nehemiah's time, as we enter Your gates with thanksgiving and Your courts with praise. Amen.
reflection: The praises that were heard were the result of God's help overcoming the opposition of enemies like Sanballat and the rebuilding of the wall. What has God given us that should cause our praises to overflow into praise? IS IT GOD'S DIRECTION IN OUR LIFE? IS IT THE COMFORT HE ALONE CAN PROVIDE IN THE TIME OF TROUBLE? OR IS IT OUR ULTIMATE GIFT OF SALVATION?
subject: Overcoming Enemies, Praising God
verse_text: The sound of rejoicing in Jerusalem could be heard far away.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Joseph -- whom the apostles called Barnabas_ (which means
"son of encouragement" _Sold a field he owned and brought_

_the money and put it at the feet of the apostles. _(Acts 4:36, 37)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The generosity and support of Barnabas demonstrates what it

means to be a son or daughter of encouragement.

HAVE YOU DECIDED HOW YOU CAN BE AN ENCOURAGER TO

SOME-ONE IN THE COMING YEAR?

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: The generosity and support of Barnabas demonstrates what it means to be a son or daughter of encouragement. HAVE YOU DECIDED HOW YOU CAN BE AN ENCOURAGE TO SOMEONE IN THE COMING YEAR?
original_verse_text: Joseph -- whom the apostles called Barnabas (which means "son of encouragement" Sold a field he owned and brought the money and put it at the feet of the apostles.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the example of Barnabas, who generously shared his resources to support the needs of the early church. May we, too, be filled with the spirit of encouragement, eager to uplift and assist our brothers and sisters in Christ. Help us discern how we can be a blessing to others in the coming year, that we may reflect Your love and generosity. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: The generosity and support of Barnabas demonstrates what it means to be a son or daughter of encouragement. Have you decided how you can be an encouragement to someone in the coming year?
subject: Become a Son of Encouragement
verse_text: Joseph -- whom the apostles called Barnabas (which means “son of encouragement” Sold a field he owned and brought the money and put it at the feet of the apostles.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_Wounds from a friend can be trusted. _(Pro. 27:6)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Solomon honored such friendship in his proverbs.
Jesus went further-- He endured the wounds of our

rejection not only to tell us the truth about ourselves

but to show us how much we are loved.

WHAT KIND OF FRIEND ARE YOU? DO YOU SHARE THE

TRUTH WITH YOUR NEIGHBOR IN LOVE?

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Solomon honored such friendship in his proverbs. Jesus went further-- He endured the wounds of our rejection not only to tell us the truth about ourselves but to show us how much we are loved. WHAT KIND OF FRIEND ARE YOU? DO YOU SHARE THE TRUTH WITH YOUR NEIGHBOR IN LOVE?
original_verse_text: Wounds from a friend can be trusted.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the gift of true friendship, where love and truth go hand in hand. Help us to follow the example of Your Son, who laid down His life for His friends, that we may speak the truth in love to those around us. May our friendships reflect the depth of Your love and the courage to confront sin with compassion. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Solomon honored such friendship in his Proverbs. Jesus went further—He endured the wounds of our rejection not only to tell us the truth about ourselves but to show us how much we are loved. What kind of friend are you? Do you share the truth with your neighbor in love?
subject: Friendship's Wounds, Love's Truth
verse_text: Wounds from a friend can be trusted.

original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 11:

_The earnest prayer of a righteous person has great _

_power and produces wonderful results. _(Jm. 5:16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God often chooses to move through our prayers to

accomplish His work. God wants us to join Him in

His work through humble, persistent prayers. When

we make it our aim to serve God through praying

faithfully, we are taking part in a beautiful privilege

where at any moment we may be given the privilege

of being a part of a miracle.

GREAT FAITH ON OUR PART HONORS GOD.
original_reflection_text: God often chooses to move through our prayers to accomplish His work. God wants us to join Him in His work through humble, persistent prayers. When we make it our aim to serve God through praying faithfully, we are taking part in a beautiful privilege where at any moment we may be given the privilege of being a part of a miracle. GREAT FAITH ON OUR PART HONORS GOD.
original_verse_text: The earnest prayer of a righteous person has great power and produces wonderful results.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging the power of prayer and the privilege to join You in Your work. Help us to approach You with humility and persistence, trusting that You will hear our supplications and move mightily in response. May our faith in You be a reflection of Your greatness, and may our prayers be a means by which You accomplish Your will. We surrender ourselves to You, Lord, and ask that You would use us as instruments of Your grace. Amen.
reflection: God often chooses to move through our prayers to accomplish His work. God wants us to join Him in His work through humble, persistent prayers. When we make it our aim to serve God through praying faithfully, we are taking part in a beautiful privilege where at any moment we may be given the privilege of being a part of a miracle. Great faith on our part honors God.
subject: Faithful Prayers Accomplish God's Work
verse_text: The earnest prayer of a righteous person has great power and produces wonderful results.

original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 12:

_You cannot serve both God and money. _(Mt. 6:24)

THOUGHT FOR DEC. 12:

Jesus devoted a substantial section of His Sermon on the

Mount to money and the fondness of it. He taught us to pray

NOT for an accumulation of riches but for _"Our daily bread"_

(Mt. 6:11) Yes He warned against storing up treasures on

earth.

TRUE, MONEY MATTERS. BUT MONEY SHOULDN'T RULE OUR

DECISION-MAKING PROCESS. TOUGH TIMES AND BIG DECISIONS

ARE OPPORTUNITIES TO GROW OUR FAITH IN NEW WAYS. BUT

NEVER FORGET OUR HEAVENLY FATHER LOVE AND CARES FOR US.

_ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Jesus devoted a substantial section of His Sermon on the Mount to money and the fondness of it. He taught us to pray NOT for an accumulation of riches but for "Our daily bread" (Matthew 6:11) Yes He warned against storing up treasures on earth. TRUE, MONEY MATTERS. BUT MONEY SHOULDN'T RULE OUR DECISION-MAKING PROCESS. TOUGH TIMES AND BIG DECISIONS ARE OPPORTUNITIES TO GROW OUR FAITH IN NEW WAYS. BUT NEVER FORGET OUR HEAVENLY FATHER LOVE AND CARES FOR US.
original_verse_text: You cannot serve both God and money.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that You alone are worthy of our worship and devotion. Help us to keep our eyes fixed on You, and not be ruled by the love of money or the pursuit of earthly treasures. May we seek first Your kingdom and Your righteousness, trusting that You will provide for our daily needs. In times of difficulty and decision-making, strengthen our faith and guide us to grow in our dependence on You. For You are a loving and faithful God who cares deeply for us. Amen.
reflection: Jesus devoted a substantial section of His Sermon on the Mount to money and the fondness of it. He taught us to pray not for an accumulation of riches but for “Our daily bread” (Matthew 6:11). Yes, He warned against storing up treasures on earth. True, money matters, but money shouldn't rule our decision-making process. Tough times and big decisions are opportunities to grow our faith in new ways. But never forget our Heavenly Father's love and cares for us.
subject: Treasures in Heaven, Not Earth
verse_text: You cannot serve both God and money.

original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 13:

_Look there, on the mountain, the feet of the one who_

_who proclaims peace. _(Nah 1:15)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Nahum and Isaiah's prophetic words of hope found their

ultimate fulfillment at the first Christmas when the angel

told the shepherds, _"Do not be afraid, I bring you good-_

_ news that will cause great joy for all people. 'Today in_

_the town of David a Savior has been born to you; He is_

_the Messiah, the Lord." _(Lk. 2:10-12)

THE MOST IMPORTANT HEADLINE IN OUR LIVES EVERY DAY

IS THE VERY BEST NEWS EVER SPOKEN-CHRIST THE SAVIOR

IS BORN.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Nahum and Isaiah's prophetic words of hope found their ultimate fulfillment at the first Christmas when the angel told the shepherds, "Do not be afraid, I bring you good- news that will cause great joy for all people. 'Today in the town of David a Savior has been born to you; He is the Messiah, the Lord. " (Luke 2:10-12) THE MOST IMPORTANT HEADLINE IN OUR LIVES EVERY DAY IS THE VERY BEST NEWS EVER SPOKEN-CHRIST THE SAVIOR IS BORN.
original_verse_text: Look there, on the mountain, the feet of the one who proclaims peace.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we rejoice in the good news of great joy that You have brought to all people—the birth of our Savior, the Messiah, the Lord. In this season and always, may the headline of our lives be the glorious truth that Christ the Savior is born. Fill our hearts with gratitude and our lives with the light of Your salvation. Amen.
reflection: Nahum and Isaiah's prophetic words of hope found their ultimate fulfillment at the first Christmas when the angel told the shepherds, “Do not be afraid, I bring you good- news that will cause great joy for all people. 'Today in the town of David a Savior has been born to you; He is the Messiah, the Lord. ” (Luke 2:10-12) THE MOST IMPORTANT HEADLINE IN OUR LIVES EVERY DAY IS THE VERY BEST NEWS EVER SPOKEN-CHRIST THE SAVIOR IS BORN.
subject: The Savior Has Come
verse_text: Look there, on the mountain, the feet of the one who proclaims peace.

original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 14:

_The darkness is passing and the true light_

_is already shinning. _(I Jn. 2:8)

THE THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The apostle John wrote these words to believers as an

encouragement. He went on to say, "_Anyone who loves _

_their brother and sister lives in the light, and there is _

_nothing in them to make them stumble." _(vs. 10). By

contrast, he equated hating people with roaming around

in darkness. Hatred is disorienting; it takes away our

sense of moral direction.

WHEN WE CHOOSE LOVE INSTEAD OF HATE, WE ARE SHOWING

OUR RELATIONSHIP TO CHRIST AND REFLECTING HIS RADIANCE

TO THE WORLD AROUND US. GOD IS LIGHT.

_ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: The apostle John wrote these words to believers as an encouragement. He went on to say, "Anyone who loves their brother and sister lives in the light, and there is nothing in them to make them stumble. " (vs. 10). By contrast, he equated hating people with roaming around in darkness. Hatred is disorienting; it takes away our sense of moral direction. WHEN WE CHOOSE LOVE INSTEAD OF HATE, WE ARE SHOWING OUR RELATIONSHIP TO CHRIST AND REFLECTING HIS RADIANCE TO THE WORLD AROUND US. GOD IS LIGHT.
original_verse_text: The darkness is passing and the true light is already shinning.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gift of love that You have bestowed upon us. Help us to walk in the light, choosing love over hatred, and reflecting the radiance of Your Son to the world around us. May our lives be a testament to Your goodness, for You are the source of all love. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: The apostle John wrote these words to believers as an encouragement. He went on to say, “Anyone who loves their brother and sister lives in the light, and there is nothing in them to make them stumble.” (vs. 10). By contrast, he equated hating people with roaming around in darkness. Hatred is disorienting; it takes away our sense of moral direction. When we choose love instead of hate, we are showing our relationship to Christ and reflecting his radiance to the world around us. God is light.
subject: Choose Love over Hate
verse_text: The darkness is passing and the true light is already shinning.

original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 15:

_We are confident, I say, and would prefer to be away_

_from the body and at home with the Lord. _(2 Thess. 5:8)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Many of us will pass into heaven through death but for some

that thought causes great anxiety. Some worry that the process

of dying will be to difficult to bear. But with the assurance of

Jesus as our Savior we can rest in the confidence that when we

close our eyes on earth and pass through death, we will open our

eyes in God's presence.

AS WE LOOK FORWARD TO SEEING JESUS IN HEAVEN IT WILL BE OUR

GREATEST JOY.
original_reflection_text: Many of us will pass into heaven through death but for some that thought causes great anxiety. Some worry that the process of dying will be to difficult to bear. But with the assurance of Jesus as our Savior we can rest in the confidence that when we close our eyes on earth and pass through death, we will open our eyes in God's presence. AS WE LOOK FORWARD TO SEEING JESUS IN HEAVEN IT WILL BE OUR GREATEST JOY.
original_verse_text: We are confident, I say, and would prefer to be away from the body and at home with the Lord.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks that through the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus, we have the assurance of eternal life with You. As we consider the day when we will pass from this world into Your presence, may we not be filled with anxiety, but with joyful anticipation. Help us to fix our eyes on the glory that awaits, where we will behold Your face and dwell in Your house forever. In the precious name of Jesus, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Many of us will pass into heaven through death, but for some, that thought causes great anxiety. Some worry that the process of dying will be too difficult to bear. But with the assurance of Jesus as our Savior, we can rest in the confidence that when we close our eyes on earth and pass through death, we will open our eyes in God's presence. As we look forward to seeing Jesus in heaven, it will be our greatest joy.
subject: Confident Passage to Heaven
verse_text: We are confident, I say, and would prefer to be away from the body and at home with the Lord.

original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 16:

_Hear the Word of the Lord. _(Jer. 7:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

This speaker's brand of _"Comfort my People"_ was another

side of God's comfort. Like a bitter herb that heals malaria,

His words were spiritually curative. When we hear hard words,

instead of walking away, may we respond to their healing effects.

GOD'S CORRECTION IS NEVER TO HARM US BUT ONLY TO HEAL US.

GOD'S DISCIPLINE IS DESIGNED TO MAKE US LIKE HIS SON.

_ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: This speaker's brand of "Comfort my People" was another side of God's comfort. Like a bitter herb that heals malaria, His words were spiritually curative. When we hear hard words, instead of walking away, may we respond to their healing effects. GOD'S CORRECTION IS NEVER TO HARM US BUT ONLY TO HEAL US. GOD'S DISCIPLINE IS DESIGNED TO MAKE US LIKE HIS SON.
original_verse_text: Hear the Word of the Lord.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that Your discipline and correction are not meant to harm us, but to shape us into the likeness of Your Son. Help us to receive Your words, even when they are difficult, with an open and receptive spirit, knowing that they are rooted in Your deep love for us. May we find comfort in the knowledge that You chasten those You love, that we may grow in righteousness and be conformed to the image of Christ. Guide us, Lord, that we may walk the path of wisdom and understanding. Amen.
reflection: This speaker's brand of “Comfort my People” was another side of God's comfort. Like a bitter herb that heals malaria, His words were spiritually curative. When we hear hard words, instead of walking away, may we respond to their healing effects. GOD'S CORRECTION IS NEVER TO HARM US BUT ONLY TO HEAL US. GOD'S DISCIPLINE IS DESIGNED TO MAKE US LIKE HIS SON.
subject: Healing Power of God's Correction
verse_text: Hear the Word of the Lord.

original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 17:

_Blessed is the one whose transgressions are forgiven,_

_whose sins are covered. _(Ps. 32:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

_When Jesus came to this world, John the Baptist called_

_Him "the Lamb of God that takes away the sin of the _

_world_." (Jn. 1:29)._ __We need our sins taken care of because _

_it separates us from God whose character and ways are_

_always perfect and right. Being right with God is a gift_

_from Him. Jesus, the Lamb, is God's way to cover us._

THE ONLY PERMANENT COVERING FOR SIN IS THE BLOOD OF CHRIST.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: When Jesus came to this world, John the Baptist called Him "the Lamb of God that takes away the sin of the world. " (John 1:29). We need our sins taken care of because it separates us from God whose character and ways are always perfect and right. Being right with God is a gift from Him. Jesus, the Lamb, is God's way to cover us. THE ONLY PERMANENT COVERING FOR SIN IS THE BLOOD OF CHRIST.
original_verse_text: Blessed is the one whose transgressions are forgiven, whose sins are covered.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for You have provided the perfect solution to our sin through Your Son, Jesus Christ. We rejoice that through faith in Him, we are no longer counted as guilty, but as Your beloved children, forgiven and made righteous. May we ever cling to the truth that the blood of the Lamb is our permanent covering, and may it draw us ever closer to You. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: When Jesus came to this world, John the Baptist called Him “the Lamb of God that takes away the sin of the world.” (John 1:29). We need our sins taken care of because it separates us from God, whose character and ways are always perfect and right. Being right with God is a gift from Him. Jesus, the Lamb, is God's way to cover us. THE ONLY PERMANENT COVERING FOR SIN IS THE BLOOD OF CHRIST.
subject: The Lamb's Permanent Covering
verse_text: Blessed is the one whose transgressions are forgiven, whose sins are covered.

original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 18:

The disciples were asked "_Who do you say I am__?" _(Mt 16:15)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

How can anyone read the Gospel's and not feel the actual

presence of Jesus? If you have not discovered this feeling,

let me assure you that eventually YOU WILL have to answer

the question, _"Who do you say Jesus is?"_

WHY? Because-THE IDENTITY OF JESUS IS THE CENTRAL QUESTION OF ETERNITY.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: How can anyone read the Gospel's and not feel the actual presence of Jesus? If you have not discovered this feeling, let me assure you that eventually YOU WILL have to answer the question, "Who do you say Jesus is?" WHY? Because-THE IDENTITY OF JESUS IS THE CENTRAL QUESTION OF ETERNITY.
original_verse_text: The disciples were asked "Who do you say I am?"
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to know the truth of who You have revealed in Your Son, Jesus Christ. As the passage in John 14:6 proclaims, Jesus is the Way, the Truth, and the Life, the only path to You. Lord, open our eyes to see the reality of Your Son's identity, that we may confess with conviction, as in Matthew 16:15, “You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.” May our lives be transformed by the power of this eternal truth. Amen.
reflection: How can anyone read the Gospels and not feel the actual presence of Jesus? If you have not discovered this feeling, let me assure you that eventually you will have to answer the question, “Who do you say Jesus is?” Why? Because the identity of Jesus is the central question of eternity.
subject: The Identity of Jesus
verse_text: The disciples were asked “Who do you say I am?”

original_content:
THE VERSE FOR DEC. 19

_Do you think you deserve credit merely for loving those who_

_love you? Even sinners do that! _(Lk. 6:32)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY?

Love means action. One way to put love to work is to take the

initiative in meeting special needs. This is easy to do with people

who love us, people whom we trust, BUT love means doing this

EVEN to people who dislike us or hurt us.

GIVE AS THOUGH YOU ARE GIVING TO GOD!

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Love means action. One way to put love to work is to take the initiative in meeting special needs. This is easy to do with people who love us, people whom we trust, BUT love means doing this EVEN to people who dislike us or hurt us. GIVE AS THOUGH YOU ARE GIVING TO GOD!
original_verse_text: Do you think you deserve credit merely for loving those who love you? Even sinners do that!
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking to embody the love and grace that You have so freely given to us. Help us to love even those who may dislike or hurt us, for Your Word teaches us to overcome evil with good. Give us the courage and wisdom to take the initiative in meeting the needs of others, recognizing that in doing so, we are serving You. May our actions be a reflection of Your unfailing love, that others may see Your light shining through us. We ask this in the precious name of Jesus. Amen.
reflection: Love means action. One way to put love to work is to take the initiative in meeting special needs. This is easy to do with people who love us, people whom we trust, but love means doing this even to people who dislike us or hurt us. Give as though you are giving to God!
subject: Loving Action Meets Special Needs
verse_text: Do you think you deserve credit merely for loving those who love you? Even sinners do that!

original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 20

_The angel said to the, "Do not be afraid, I bring you good _

_news that will cause great joy for all people." _(Lk. 2:10)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The gospel of Luke tells us that God sent an angle to ordinary

shepherds to deliver an extraordinary birth announcement.

Since then this message has been spread through the centuries

to us, AND NOW we are Christ's messengers of joy to the world.

THROUGH the indwelling of the Holy Spirit, we continue the

practice of spreading the joy of Jesus as we follow His example

and serve others.

LET US TAKE THE JOY OF CHRISTMAS WITH US EVERY DAY!
original_reflection_text: The gospel of Luke tells us that God sent an angle to ordinary shepherds to deliver an extraordinary birth announcement. Since then this message has been spread through the centuries to us, AND NOW we are Christ's messengers of joy to the world. THROUGH the indwelling of the Holy Spirit, we continue the practice of spreading the joy of Jesus as we follow His example and serve others. LET US TAKE THE JOY OF CHRISTMAS WITH US EVERY DAY!
original_verse_text: The angel said to the, "Do not be afraid, I bring you good news that will cause great joy for all people."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the extraordinary good news of great joy that the angel proclaimed to the shepherds - that a Savior, who is Christ the Lord, has been born. Fill us with the hope, peace, and joy of the Holy Spirit, that we may be your messengers of gladness to the world, following the example of Jesus in loving and serving others. May the joy of Christmas remain in our hearts every day. Amen.
reflection: The gospel of Luke tells us that God sent an angel to ordinary shepherds to deliver an extraordinary birth announcement. Since then, this message has been spread through the centuries to us, and now we are Christ's messengers of joy to the world. Through the indwelling of the Holy Spirit, we continue the practice of spreading the joy of Jesus as we follow His example and serve others. Let us take the joy of Christmas with us every day!
subject: Spread the Joy of Christmas
verse_text: The angel said to the, “Do not be afraid, I bring you good news that will cause great joy for all people.”

original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 21:

_Even if my Father and mother abandon me,_

_the Lord will hold me close. _(Ps. 27:10)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Many have had the sad experience of be abandoned by

father and mother. Broken homes, difference in belief.

addiction to drugs or alcohol, even psychological isolation

can leave children crippled by this loss. Even as adults,

the pain may linger.

GOD CAN TAKE THAT PLACE IN OUR LIFE, FILL THAT VOID, AND

HEAL THAT HURT.

_ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Many have had the sad experience of be abandoned by father and mother. Broken homes, difference in belief. addiction to drugs or alcohol, even psychological isolation can leave children crippled by this loss. Even as adults, the pain may linger. GOD CAN TAKE THAT PLACE IN OUR LIFE, FILL THAT VOID, AND HEAL THAT HURT.
original_verse_text: Even if my Father and mother abandon me, the Lord will hold me close.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in our time of need, for You are the Father to the fatherless and the defender of the widow (Psalm 68:5). When we have been abandoned or isolated, we find comfort in Your unwavering love and steadfast presence. Lord, fill the void in our hearts and heal the wounds of our past. May we find in You the perfect Father who will never leave or forsake us (Psalm 27:10). We trust in Your compassion and grace. Amen.
reflection: Many have had the sad experience of being abandoned by father and mother. Broken homes, differences in belief, addiction to drugs or alcohol, even psychological isolation can leave children crippled by this loss. Even as adults, the pain may linger. God can take that place in our life, fill that void, and heal that hurt.
subject: God's Unfailing Fatherly Love
verse_text: Even if my Father and mother abandon me, the Lord will hold me close.

original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 22:

_Always be prepared to give an answer to everyone who_

_asks you to give the reason for the hope that you have._

(I Pet. 3:15)

THE THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Some Christians believe that faith is a personal matter that

should be kept to oneself. It is true we shouldn't be boisterous

or obnoxious in sharing our faith, but we should always be

ready to give an answer, gently and respectfully, when asked

about our faith, our lifestyle, or our Christian perspective.

ARE YOU PREPARED TO TELL OTHERS WHAT CHRIST HAS DONE IN

YOUR LIFE?

_ PASTOR AL__ _
original_reflection_text: Some Christians believe that faith is a personal matter that should be kept to oneself. It is true we shouldn't be boisterous or obnoxious in sharing our faith, but we should always be ready to give an answer, gently and respectfully, when asked about our faith, our lifestyle, or our Christian perspective. ARE YOU PREPARED TO TELL OTHERS WHAT CHRIST HAS DONE IN YOUR LIFE?
original_verse_text: Always be prepared to give an answer to everyone who asks you to give the reason for the hope that you have.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gift of salvation through Your Son, Jesus Christ. Grant us the courage and wisdom to always be prepared to give a reason for the hope that we have, with gentleness and respect, as Your Word instructs. May we never be ashamed of the gospel, for it is the power of God for salvation to everyone who believes. Help us to live in such a way that others may see Your light shining through us. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: Some Christians believe that faith is a personal matter that should be kept to oneself. It is true we shouldn't be boisterous or obnoxious in sharing our faith, but we should always be ready to give an answer, gently and respectfully, when asked about our faith, our lifestyle, or our Christian perspective. Are you prepared to tell others what Christ has done in your life?
subject: Prepared to Tell Others Your Faith
verse_text: Always be prepared to give an answer to everyone who asks you to give the reason for the hope that you have.

original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 23:

_Praise the Lord, my soul, and forget not all His_

_benefits_. (Ps. 103:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The most important gift we can ever receive is God's gift of

His Son, our Savior, and with Him forgiveness, restoration,

and the promise of eternal life that begins now and lasts forever.

And the most important gift we can give is to give Jesus our heart.

IF WE WERE A WISE MEN, WE WOULD DO OUR PART. YET WHAT CAN WE

GIVE HIM---LETS GIVE HIM OUR HEART.
original_reflection_text: The most important gift we can ever receive is God's gift of His Son, our Savior, and with Him forgiveness, restoration, and the promise of eternal life that begins now and lasts forever. And the most important gift we can give is to give Jesus our heart. IF WE WERE A WISE MEN, WE WOULD DO OUR PART. YET WHAT CAN WE GIVE HIM---LETS GIVE HIM OUR HEART.
original_verse_text: Praise the Lord, my soul, and forget not all His benefits.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give You thanks and praise for the most precious gift of Your Son, our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ. Through Him, we have received forgiveness, restoration, and the promise of eternal life. May we, like the wise men, offer You the gift of our hearts, that we may walk in Your ways and live for Your glory. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: The most important gift we can ever receive is God's gift of His Son, our Savior, and with Him forgiveness, restoration, and the promise of eternal life that begins now and lasts forever. And the most important gift we can give is to give Jesus our heart. IF WE WERE A WISE MEN, WE WOULD DO OUR PART. YET WHAT CAN WE GIVE HIM---LETS GIVE HIM OUR HEART.
subject: Receive God's Greatest Gift
verse_text: Praise the Lord, my soul, and forget not all His benefits.

original_content:
THE VERSE FOR DEC. 24:

_On those living in the land of deep darkness a_

_light has dawned. _(Isa. 9:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Out of the brilliance that surround the shepherds a

shinning ray fell into our darkness. So this Christmas

let us embrace the Good News that God, in Christ, HAS

bridged the gap between us.

NO MATTER WHERE TODAY FINDS US, JESUS HAS PENETRATED

OUR DARK WORLD WITH HIS JOY AND LIGHT.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Out of the brilliance that surround the shepherds a shinning ray fell into our darkness. So this Christmas let us embrace the Good News that God, in Christ, HAS bridged the gap between us. NO MATTER WHERE TODAY FINDS US, JESUS HAS PENETRATED OUR DARK WORLD WITH HIS JOY AND LIGHT.
original_verse_text: On those living in the land of deep darkness a light has dawned.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the light that has shone into our darkness through the birth of Your Son, Jesus Christ. As the shepherds were filled with joy at the good news of His coming, so too may our hearts be filled with the radiance of Your salvation. May the light of Christ dispel the gloom and despair that so often surrounds us, and may we embrace the hope and joy that He brings. We give thanks for Your love that has bridged the gap between us, and we ask that You continue to guide us in Your ways. Amen.
reflection: Out of the brilliance that surrounds the shepherds, a shining ray fell into our darkness. So this Christmas, let us embrace the Good News that God, in Christ, has bridged the gap between us. No matter where today finds us, Jesus has penetrated our dark world with His joy and light.
subject: The Good News Shines Bright
verse_text: On those living in the land of deep darkness a light has dawned.

original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 25:

_Do not be afraid. I bring you good news that will_

_cause great joy for all the people. _(Lk. 2:10)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The joy was not for a few people, but for all people.

"For God so loved the whole world that He gave His

one and only Son." (Jn. 3:16) As we share the lifechanging message of Jesus with others, we need to

join the worldwide chorus in proclaiming, "The glories

of His righteousness and the wonders of His love."

THE GOOD NEWS OF JESUS'S BIRTH IS A SOURCE OF JOY FOR

ALL PEOPLE.
original_reflection_text: The joy was not for a few people, but for all people. "For God so loved the whole world that He gave His one and only Son. " (John 3:16) As we share the lifechanging message of Jesus with others, we need to join the worldwide chorus in proclaiming, "The glories of His righteousness and the wonders of His love. " THE GOOD NEWS OF JESUS'S BIRTH IS A SOURCE OF JOY FOR ALL PEOPLE.
original_verse_text: Do not be afraid. I bring you good news that will cause great joy for all the people.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we rejoice in the good news of Your Son's birth, which brings great joy to all people. Fill our hearts with the wonder of Your love and righteousness, that we may boldly proclaim the life-changing message of Jesus to the world. May the light of Christ shine brightly, drawing all people to Yourself. In Your Son's name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: The joy was not for a few people, but for all people. “For God so loved the whole world that He gave His one and only Son.” (John 3:16) As we share the life-changing message of Jesus with others, we need to join the worldwide chorus in proclaiming, “The glories of His righteousness and the wonders of His love.” The good news of Jesus's birth is a source of joy for all people.
subject: The Joy for All People
verse_text: Do not be afraid. I bring you good news that will cause great joy for all the people.

original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 26

_When the set time had fully come, God sent His Son._

(Gal. 4:4)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

When we become discouraged because God doesn't respond

according to our time table. Christmas reminds us that "when

the set time had fully come, God sent His Son. that we

might receive adoption to sonship: (Gal. 4:4-5)

GOD'S TIMING IS ALWAYS RIGHT, LET US REMEMBER TO

PRAY FOR PATIENCE!

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: When we become discouraged because God doesn't respond according to our time table. Christmas reminds us that "when the set time had fully come, God sent His Son. that we might receive adoption to sonship: (Galatians 4:4-5) GOD'S TIMING IS ALWAYS RIGHT, LET US REMEMBER TO PRAY FOR PATIENCE!
original_verse_text: When the set time had fully come, God sent His Son.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that Your timing is always perfect. When we grow impatient, help us to remember the example of Your Son, who came in the fullness of time to redeem us and make us Your children. Grant us the wisdom to wait upon You, trusting that in Your perfect plan, all things will be revealed in due season. Give us the patience to endure and the faith to persevere as we hope in the promises You have made. Amen.
reflection: When we become discouraged because God doesn't respond according to our timetable. Christmas reminds us that “when the set time had fully come, God sent His Son, that we might receive adoption to sonship” (Galatians 4:4-5). God's timing is always right. Let us remember to pray for patience.
subject: God's Timing is Always Right
verse_text: When the set time had fully come, God sent His Son.

original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 27:

_We did not follow cleverly devised stories when we told _

_you about the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ in power, _

_but we were eyewitnesses of His majesty. _(2 Pet. 1:16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The Bible is not a collection of fables or human ideas about

God. It is God's very words given through people to people.

Peter emphasized his authority as an eyewitness as well as the

God inspired authority of Scripture to prepare the way for his

harsh words against false teachers.

OUR FAITH MUST GO BEYOND WHAT WE BELIEVE, IT MUST BECOME

A PART OF ALL WE DO

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: The Bible is not a collection of fables or human ideas about God. It is God's very words given through people to people. Peter emphasized his authority as an eyewitness as well as the God inspired authority of Scripture to prepare the way for his harsh words against false teachers. OUR FAITH MUST GO BEYOND WHAT WE BELIEVE, IT MUST BECOME A PART OF ALL WE DO
original_verse_text: We did not follow cleverly devised stories when we told you about the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ in power, but we were eyewitnesses of His majesty.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, for Your Word is a lamp to our feet and a light to our path. We thank You that the Scriptures are not mere human ideas, but the very words You have breathed through Your servants, revealing the truth about Your Son, the eternal Word who was with You from the beginning. Help us, Lord, to not just believe Your Word, but to let it transform our lives, that our faith may be more than mere words, but a living, active part of all we do. May we walk in the light of Your truth, and bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: The Bible is not a collection of fables or human ideas about God. It is God's very words given through people to people. Peter emphasized his authority as an eyewitness as well as the God-inspired authority of Scripture to prepare the way for his harsh words against false teachers. Our faith must go beyond what we believe; it must become a part of all we do.
subject: Become More than Beliefs
verse_text: We did not follow cleverly devised stories when we told you about the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ in power, but we were eyewitnesses of His majesty.

original_content:
_VERSE FOR DEC. 28_

_Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good; His love_

_endures forever. _(Ps. 106:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The promises of the unfailing and everlasting nature of

God's love are found throughout Scripture. And the

greatest proof of His love is the death of His Son so

that those who put their faith in Him can live eternally.

FELLOW BELIEVERS, WE ARE LOCKED INTO GOD'S LOVE FOREVER!

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: The promises of the unfailing and everlasting nature of God's love are found throughout Scripture. And the greatest proof of His love is the death of His Son so that those who put their faith in Him can live eternally. FELLOW BELIEVERS, WE ARE LOCKED INTO GOD'S LOVE FOREVER!
original_verse_text: Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good; His love endures forever.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for Your steadfast love that endures forever. Your love for us is unshakable, unending, and unfailing, as Your Word declares. May we rest secure in the truth that nothing can separate us from Your love, for You have shown the depth of Your affection through the sacrifice of Your Son. We give You thanks and glorify Your name. Amen.
reflection: The promises of the unfailing and everlasting nature of God's love are found throughout Scripture. And the greatest proof of His love is the death of His Son so that those who put their faith in Him can live eternally. Fellow believers, we are locked into God's love forever!
subject: Locked into God's Eternal Love
verse_text: Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good; His love endures forever.

original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 29:

_I will make you like My signet ring, for I have chosen you,_

_declares the Lord. _(Haggai 2:23)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In ancient times, the signet ring was used as a means of

identification. Instead of signing their name, People would

press their ring into hot wax or soft clay to make their mark.

As God's children, we make our mark on the world as we

spread the gospel, share His grace through loving our neighbors,

and work to end oppression.

EACH OF US HAVE OUR OWN UNIQUE STAMP THAT REVEALS HOW WE'RE

CREATED IN GOD'S IMAGE.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: In ancient times, the signet ring was used as a means of identification. Instead of signing their name, People would press their ring into hot wax or soft clay to make their mark. As God's children, we make our mark on the world as we spread the gospel, share His grace through loving our neighbors, and work to end oppression. EACH OF US HAVE OUR OWN UNIQUE STAMP THAT REVEALS HOW WE'RE CREATED IN GOD'S IMAGE.
original_verse_text: I will make you like My signet ring, for I have chosen you, declares the Lord.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for creating us in Your image and calling us to be Your people. Help us to embrace the unique ways You have shaped us, that we may make our mark on the world by sharing the good news of Your Son and serving others with Your love. Use us as Your signet ring, that our lives may bear the imprint of Your grace and draw many to know You. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: In ancient times, the signet ring was used as a means of identification. Instead of signing their name, people would press their ring into hot wax or soft clay to make their mark. As God's children, we make our mark on the world as we spread the gospel, share His grace through loving our neighbors, and work to end oppression. Each of us has our own unique stamp that reveals how we're created in God's image.
subject: Unique Stamp Reveals God's Image
verse_text: I will make you like My signet ring, for I have chosen you, declares the Lord.

original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 30:

[Jesus] _went up on a mountainside by Himself to pray._

Mt. 14:23

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Jesus repeatedly help multitudes of people, yet He didn't

allow Himself to become haggard and hurried. He

nurtured His connection with God through prayer. How

is it with you? Do you take time with God to experience

His strength and fulfillment.

WHEN WE DRAW NEAR TO GOD OUR MINDS ARE REFRESHED

AND OUR STRENGTH IS RENEWED!

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: Jesus repeatedly help multitudes of people, yet He didn't allow Himself to become haggard and hurried. He nurtured His connection with God through prayer. How is it with you? Do you take time with God to experience His strength and fulfillment. WHEN WE DRAW NEAR TO GOD OUR MINDS ARE REFRESHED AND OUR STRENGTH IS RENEWED!
original_verse_text: [Jesus] went up on a mountainside by Himself to pray.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You with grateful hearts, seeking the peace and stillness that only You can provide. Like Your Son, Jesus, may we make time to withdraw from the demands of the world and commune with You in prayer. Help us to be still and know that You are God, the source of our strength and refuge. Renew our minds and spirits, that we may be empowered to serve You and others with renewed energy and purpose. In Your holy name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Jesus repeatedly helped multitudes of people, yet He didn't allow Himself to become haggard and hurried. He nurtured His connection with God through prayer. How is it with you? Do you take time with God to experience His strength and fulfillment? When we draw near to God, our minds are refreshed and our strength is renewed!
subject: Renew Your Strength in God
verse_text: [Jesus] went up on a mountainside by Himself to pray.

original_content:
VERSE FOR DEC. 31:

_I tell you, now is the time of God's favor, now is the day_

_of salvation. _2 Cor. 6:2.

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We need to keep this verse as a reminder; _"Now is the day_

_of salvation." WHY? _Have you asked Jesus into your heart?

Do you have the assurance that you will have another day?

Has the Holy Spirit alerted you to your need to put your

trust in Jesus? Don't put it off! Run to Jesus. The Apostle

Paul reminds us: _"Now is the day!"_

_REMEMBER THERE'S NO BETTER DAY THAN TODAY TO ENTER INTO_

_GOD'S FAMILY!_

_HAVE A HAPPY AND BLESSED NEW YEAR IN THE LORD'S FAVOR!_

_ PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: We need to keep this verse as a reminder; "Now is the day of salvation. " WHY? Have you asked Jesus into your heart? Do you have the assurance that you will have another day? Has the Holy Spirit alerted you to your need to put your trust in Jesus? Don't put it off! Run to Jesus. The Apostle Paul reminds us: "Now is the day!" REMEMBER THERE'S NO BETTER DAY THAN TODAY TO ENTER INTO GOD'S FAMILY! HAVE A HAPPY AND BLESSED NEW YEAR IN THE LORD'S FAVOR!
original_verse_text: I tell you, now is the time of God's favor, now is the day of salvation.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging Your great love and mercy that have saved us from our sins. We are reminded that now is the day of salvation, and we thank You for the assurance of eternal life through faith in Your Son, Jesus Christ. May we not delay in putting our trust in You, but may we run to You today, for You have made us alive in Christ. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: We need to keep this verse as a reminder: “Now is the day of salvation.” Why? Have you asked Jesus into your heart? Do you have the assurance that you will have another day? Has the Holy Spirit alerted you to your need to put your trust in Jesus? Don't put it off! Run to Jesus. The Apostle Paul reminds us: “Now is the day!” Remember, there's no better day than today to enter into God's family! Have a happy and blessed new year in the Lord's favor!
subject: Embrace Today's Salvation Call
verse_text: I tell you, now is the time of God's favor, now is the day of salvation.

original_content:
VERSE FOR JAN. 1:

_We who are still alive and are left will. meet the Lord in the _

_air. And so we will be with the Lord forever. _I Thess. 4:17

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In an increasingly chaotic world, what a hopeful thought that

this could be the year that Jesus returns. More comforting still

is the anticipation that all who trust Him for salvation will be

gathered together, relieved from this world's suffering, sorrow,

and fear. Best of all, we'll be with the Lord forever.

NEW YEAR'S RESOLUTION. SUGGESTION

SHARE FAITH. OFFER PRAYER. GATHER HOPE.

_PASTOR AL_
original_reflection_text: In an increasingly chaotic world, what a hopeful thought that this could be the year that Jesus returns. More comforting still is the anticipation that all who trust Him for salvation will be gathered together, relieved from this world's suffering, sorrow, and fear. Best of all, we'll be with the Lord forever. NEW YEAR'S RESOLUTION. SUGGESTION SHARE FAITH. OFFER PRAYER. GATHER HOPE.
original_verse_text: We who are still alive and are left will. meet the Lord in the air. And so we will be with the Lord forever.
prayer: Heavenly Father, in this new year, we are filled with hope and anticipation of the day when Your Son, our Lord Jesus Christ, will return to gather us to Yourself. We long for the day when all who trust in Him will be relieved from the burdens of this world and be with You forever. Grant us the courage to share this faith with others, that they too may find the hope and comfort we have in You. We await that glorious day with joyful expectation. Amen.
reflection: In an increasingly chaotic world, what a hopeful thought that this could be the year that Jesus returns. More comforting still is the anticipation that all who trust Him for salvation will be gathered together, relieved from this world's suffering, sorrow, and fear. Best of all, we'll be with the Lord forever. New Year's resolution: share faith, offer prayer, gather hope.
subject: Gather Hope in New Year
verse_text: We who are still alive and are left will. meet the Lord in the air. And so we will be with the Lord forever.
